|Intitle=Clinical iconography of a typical example of a vesicular eruption of the concha in favour of zoster PFP
|Description=Visualisation of vesicles in Ramsay Hunt's area pointing to zoster viral PFP
|Rubric=Multimedia content
|Contributors=
|Order=12}}
See the CEN website: www.cen-neurologie.fr where videos are available

question.title: What is the typical appearance of a vesicular eruption of the concha in Ramsay Hunt's area?
question.description: Visualisation of vesicles in Ramsay Hunt's area pointing to zoster viral PFP

option_a.title: A vesicular eruption of the concha with a red, swollen appearance
option_a.description: A vesicular eruption of the concha with a red, swollen appearance

option_b.title: A vesicular eruption of the concha with a yellow, pus-like appearance
option_b.description: A vesicular eruption of the concha with a yellow, pus-like appearance

option_c.title: A vesicular eruption of the concha with a white, scaly appearance
option_c.description: A vesicular eruption of the concha with a white, scaly appearance

option_d.title: A vesicular eruption of the concha with a red, swollen appearance and a characteristic Ramsay Hunt's sign
option_d.description: A vesicular eruption of the concha with a red, swollen appearance and a characteristic Ramsay Hunt's sign

correct_option.title: A vesicular eruption of the concha with a red, swollen appearance and a characteristic Ramsay Hunt's sign
correct_option.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option
